wikipedia_page.main:
Alban Douglas Rendall Caroe OBE FSA FRIBA (17 April 1904 − 11 December 1991) was a British architect.
He was the son of W. D. Caroe and brother of Sir Olaf Caroe.  He married Gwendolen Mary Bragg (1907-1982), daughter of William Henry Bragg.  His son, with whom he worked, was Martin Caroe.  His daughter, Lucy Caroe, historical geographer, married Richard Adrian, 2nd Baron Adrian. He was appointed an OBE in the 1987 Birthday Honours.

response: * 1962: Victorian Chancel replaced to designs by Alban Caroe

In 1889, in Adelaide, Bragg married Gwendoline Todd, a skilled water-colour painter, and daughter of astronomer, meteorologist and electrical engineer Sir Charles Todd. They had three children, a daughter, Gwendolen and two sons, William Lawrence, born in 1890 in North Adelaide, and Robert. Gwendolen married the English architect Alban Caroe, Bragg taught William at the University of Adelaide, and Robert was killed in the Battle of Gallipoli. Bragg's wife, Gwendoline, died in 1929.

In 1967 he married Lucy Caroe, historical geographer. She was the daughter of the architect Alban Caroe and her grandfathers were W. D. Caröe and William Bragg. They had no children, and on his death in 1995, the title Baron Adrian became extinct.

Caroe was born on 15 November 1933 was the son of the architect Alban Caroe and Gwendolen Mary (née Bragg), daughter of Sir William Henry Bragg. He was educated at Amesbury School, Winchester College and Trinity College, Cambridge (BA, 1957)."Caroe, Martin Bragg, (15 Nov. 1933–19 Nov. 1999), conservation architect, specialising in the care of historic buildings; Partner, Caroe & Partners, since 1963."
